By what measure? What does it even mean to “rule” something? Both light and gravity have profound effects - and if either were any different than they are, the universe would be a very different place. Neither one nor the other is in any way “unnecessary”. If there was no light then there would be no light pressure to counteract gravity and all stars would collapse into black holes, neutron stars or black dwarfs. Without supernova explosions to recycle material, there could be no 2nd generation stars - so I presume there would be no elements higher than iron in the periodic table. If there was no gravity then there would be no stars, planets, moons - just a more or less uniform sea of particles. Without stars, there would be very little light. Honestly - this isn’t a very meaningful question.
